page.title: 03SUDBURY VILLAGE ..2
page.content: Next to the turning to Gib Lane there is the{Post Office. }It sells many different items including groceries, bread, cigarettes, newspapers and magazines. Down Gib Lane is a{Doctor's {Surgery,}the{Parish Rooms}and a {hairdresser. Along the main road is a{pub.}It is called the{Vernon Arms,}which is named after George Vernon who built Sudbury Hall. It used to be a coaching inn. Then there are the{Estate offices where people pay their rent, because most of the houses are rented off Lord Vernon. This is why all the doors are painted green. Sudbury also has a{Hall.}It is open to the public. It was once owned by Lord Vernon, but is now owned by the {National Trust.The Museum of Childhood is also in the Hall. contd.....
